\subsubsection{List (lv\_list)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/list:list-lv-list}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/list::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/list:overview}}
The Lists are built from a background {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} and {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/btn::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Buttons}}}} on it.
The Buttons contain an optional icon-like {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/img::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Image}}}} (which can be a symbol too) and a {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/label::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Label}}}}.
When the list becomes long enough it can be scrolled.


\subparagraph{Add buttons}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/list:add-buttons}}
You can add new list elements with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_add\_btn(list, \&icon\_img, "Text")}} or with symbol \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_add\_btn(list, SYMBOL\_EDIT, "Edit text")}}.
If you do not want to add image use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} as image source. The function returns with a pointer to the created button to allow further configurations.

The width of the buttons is set to maximum according to the object width.
The height of the buttons are adjusted automatically according to the content. (\sphinxstyleemphasis{content height} + \sphinxstyleemphasis{padding.top} + \sphinxstyleemphasis{padding.bottom}).

The labels are created with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_LABEL\_LONG\_SROLL\_CIRC}} long mode to automatically scroll the long labels circularly.

You can use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_get\_btn\_label(list\_btn)}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_get\_btn\_img(list\_btn)}} to get the label and the image of a list button. You can get the text directly with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_get\_btn\_text(list\_btn)}}.


\subparagraph{Delete buttons}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/list:delete-buttons}}
To delete a list element just use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_del(btn)}} on the return value of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_add\_btn()}}.

To clean the list (remove all buttons) use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_clean(list)}}


\subparagraph{Manual navigation}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/list:manual-navigation}}
You can navigate manually in the list with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_up(list)}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_down(list)}}.

You can focus on a button directly using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_focus(btn, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}}.

The \sphinxstylestrong{animation time} of up/down/focus movements can be set via: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_set\_anim\_time(list, anim\_time)}}. Zero animation time means not animations.


\subparagraph{Edge flash}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/list:edge-flash}}
A circle-like effect can be shown when the list reaches the most top or bottom position.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_set\_edge\_flash(list, en)}} enables this feature.


\subparagraph{Scroll propagation}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/list:scroll-propagation}}
If the list is created on an other scrollable element (like a {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}}) and the list can’t be scrolled further the \sphinxstylestrong{scrolling can be propagated to the parent}.
This way the scroll will be continued on the parent. It can be enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_set\_scroll\_propagation(list, true)}}

If the buttons have \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_btn\_set\_toggle}} enabled then \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_set\_single\_mode(list, true)}} can be used to ensure that only one button can be in toggled state at the same time.


\paragraph{Style usage}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/list:style-usage}}
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_set\_style(list, LV\_LIST\_STYLE\_..., \&style)}} function sets the style of a list.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LIST\_STYLE\_BG} list background style. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_transp\_fit}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LIST\_STYLE\_SCRL} scrollable part’s style. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LIST\_STYLE\_SB} scrollbars’ style. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty\_color}}. For details see {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LIST\_STYLE\_BTN\_REL} button released style. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_rel}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LIST\_STYLE\_BTN\_PR} button pressed style. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_pr}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LIST\_STYLE\_BTN\_TGL\_REL} button toggled released style. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_tgl\_rel}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LIST\_STYLE\_BTN\_TGL\_PR} button toggled pressed style. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_tgl\_pr}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_LIST\_STYLE\_BTN\_INA} button inactive style. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_ina}}

\end{itemize}

Because \sphinxstyleemphasis{BG} has a transparent style by default if there is only a few buttons the list will look shorter but become scrollable when more list elements are added.

To modify the height of the buttons adjust the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{body.padding.top/bottom}} fields of the corresponding styles (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_LIST\_STYLE\_BTN\_REL/PR/...}})


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/list:events}}
Only the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} are sent by the object type.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/list:keys}}
The following \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the Lists:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT/DOWN} Select the next button

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT/UP} Select the previous button

\end{itemize}

Note that, as usual, the state of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_KEY\_ENTER}} is translated to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_PRESSED/PRESSING/RELEASED}} etc.

The Selected buttons are in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_BTN\_STATE\_PR/TG\_PR}} state.

To manually select a button use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_list\_set\_btn\_selected(list, btn)}}. When the list is defocused and focused again it will restore the last selected button.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.

\subsubsection{Line meter (lv\_lmeter)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/lmeter:line-meter-lv-lmeter}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/lmeter::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/lmeter:overview}}
The Line Meter object consists of some radial lines which draw a scale.


\subparagraph{Set value}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/lmeter:set-value}}
When setting a new value with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_lmeter\_set\_value(lmeter, new\_value)}} the proportional part of the scale will be recolored.


\subparagraph{Range and Angles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/lmeter:range-and-angles}}
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_lmeter\_set\_range(lmeter, min, max)}} function sets the range of the line meter.

You can set the angle of the scale and the number of the lines by: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_lmeter\_set\_scale(lmeter, angle, line\_num)}}.
The default angle is 240 and the default line number is 31.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/lmeter:styles}}
The line meter uses one style which can be set by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_lmeter\_set\_style(lmeter, LV\_LMETER\_STYLE\_MAIN, \&style)}}. The line meter’s properties are derived from the following style attributes:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{line.color} “inactive line’s” color which are greater then the current value

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{body.main\_color} “active line’s” color at the beginning of the scale

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{body.grad\_color} “active line’s” color at the end of the scale (gradient with main color)

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{body.padding.hor} line length

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{line.width} line width

\end{itemize}

The default style is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty\_color}}.


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/lmeter:events}}
Only the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} are sent by the object type.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/lmeter:keys}}
No \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the object type.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.

\subsubsection{Message box (lv\_mbox)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/mbox:message-box-lv-mbox}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/mbox::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/mbox:overview}}
The Message boxes act as pop-ups. They are built from a background {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/cont::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Container}}}}, a {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/label::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Label}}}} and a {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/btnm::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Button matrix}}}} for buttons.

The text will be broken into multiple lines automatically (has \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_LABEL\_LONG\_MODE\_BREAK}}) and the height will be set automatically to involve the text and the buttons (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_FIT\_TIGHT}} auto fit vertically)-


\subparagraph{Set text}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/mbox:set-text}}
To set the text use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_mbox\_set\_text(mbox, "My text")}} function.


\subparagraph{Add buttons}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/mbox:add-buttons}}
To add buttons use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_mbox\_add\_btns(mbox, btn\_str)}} function. You need specify the button’s text like \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{const char * btn\_str{[}{]} = \{"Apply", "Close", ""\}}}.
For more information visit the {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/btnm::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Button matrix}}}} documentation.


\subparagraph{Auto-close}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/mbox:auto-close}}
With \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_mbox\_start\_auto\_close(mbox, delay)}} the message box can be closed automatically after \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{delay}} milliseconds with an animation. The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_mbox\_stop\_auto\_close(mbox)}} function stops a started auto close.

The duration of the close animation can be set by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_mbox\_set\_anim\_time(mbox, anim\_time)}}.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/mbox:styles}}
Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_mbox\_set\_style(mbox, LV\_MBOX\_STYLE\_...,  \&style)}} to set a new style for an element of the Message box:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_MBOX\_STYLE\_BG} specifies the background container’s style. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} sets the background and\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\_style.label}} sets the text appearance. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_MBOX\_STYLE\_BTN\_BG} style of the Button matrix background. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_trans}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_MBOX\_STYLE\_BTN\_REL} style of the released buttons. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_rel}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_MBOX\_STYLE\_BTN\_PR} style of the pressed buttons. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_pr}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_MBOX\_STYLE\_BTN\_TGL\_REL} style of the toggled released buttons. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_tgl\_rel}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_MBOX\_STYLE\_BTN\_TGL\_PR} style of the toggled pressed buttons. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_tgl\_pr}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_MBOX\_STYLE\_BTN\_INA} style of the inactive buttons. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_ina}}

\end{itemize}

The height of the button area comes from \sphinxstyleemphasis{font height + padding.top + padding.bottom} of \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_MBOX\_STYLE\_BTN\_REL}}.


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/mbox:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Message boxes:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} sent when the button is clicked. The event data is set to ID of the clicked button.

\end{itemize}

The Message box has a default event callback which closes itself when a button is clicked.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.

\#\#Keys

The following \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the Buttons:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT/DOWN} Select the next button

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT/TOP} Select the previous button

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_ENTER} Clicks the selected button

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.

\subsubsection{Page (lv\_page)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/page:page-lv-page}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/page::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/page:overview}}
The Page consist of two {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Containers}}}} on each other:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
a \sphinxstylestrong{background} (or base)

\item {} 
a top which is \sphinxstylestrong{scrollable}.

\end{itemize}

The background object can be referenced as the page itself like: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_width(page, 100)}}.

If you create a child on the page it will be automatically moved to the scrollable container.
If the scrollable container becomes larger then the background it can be *scrolled by dragging (like the lists on smartphones).

By default, the scrollable’s has \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_FIT\_FILL}}auto fit in all directions.
It means the scrollable size will be the same as the background’s size (minus the paddings) while the children are in the background.
But when an object is positioned out of the background the scrollable size will be increased to involve it.


\subparagraph{Scrollbars}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/page:scrollbars}}
Scrollbars can be shown according to four policies:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SB\_MODE\_OFF} Never show scrollbars

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SB\_MODE\_ON} Always show scrollbars

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SB\_MODE\_DRAG} Show scrollbars when the page is being dragged

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SB\_MODE\_AUTO} Show scrollbars when the scrollable container is large enough to be scrolled

\end{itemize}

You can set scroll bar show policy by: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_sb\_mode(page, SB\_MODE)}}. The default value is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SB\_MODE\_AUTO}}.


\subparagraph{Glue object}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/page:glue-object}}
You can glue children to the page. In this case, you can scroll the page by dragging the child object.
It can be enabled by the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_glue\_obj(child, true)}}.


\subparagraph{Focus object}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/page:focus-object}}
You can focus on an object on a page with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_focus(page, child, LV\_ANIM\_ONO/FF)}}.
It will move the scrollable container to show a child. The time of the animation can be set by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_anim\_time(page, anim\_time)}} in milliseconds.


\subparagraph{Manual navigation}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/page:manual-navigation}}
You can move the scrollable object manually using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_scroll\_hor(page, dist)}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_scroll\_ver(page, dist)}}


\subparagraph{Edge flash}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/page:edge-flash}}
A circle-like effect can be shown if the list reached the most top/bottom/left/right position. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_edge\_flash(list, en)}} enables this feature.


\subparagraph{Scroll propagation}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/page:scroll-propagation}}
If the list is created on an other scrollable element (like an other page) and the Page can’t be scrolled further the scrolling can be propagated to the parent to continue the scrolling on the parent.
It can be enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scroll\_propagation(list, true)}}


\subparagraph{Scrollable API}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/page:scrollable-api}}
There are functions to directly set/get the scrollable’s attributes:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_get\_scrl()}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scrl\_fit/fint2/fit4()}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scrl\_width()}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scrl\_height()}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scrl\_layout()}}

\end{itemize}


\subparagraph{Notes}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/page:notes}}
The background draws its border when the scrollable is drawn. It ensures that the page always will have a closed shape even if the scrollable has the same color as the Page’s parent.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/page:styles}}
Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_style(page, LV\_PAGE\_STYLE\_...,  \&style)}} to set a new style for an element of the page:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PAGE\_STYLE\_BG} background’s style which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty\_color}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PAGE\_STYLE\_SCRL} scrollable’s style which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PAGE\_STYLE\_SB} scrollbar’s style which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.right/bottom}} sets horizontal and vertical the scrollbars’ padding respectively and the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.inner}} sets the scrollbar’s width. (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty\_color}})

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/page:events}}
Only the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} are sent by the object type.

The scrollable object has a default event callback which propagates the following events to the background object:
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_PRESSED}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_PRESSING}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_PRESS\_LOST}},\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_RELEASED}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_SHORT\_CLICKED}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_CLICKED}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_LONG\_PRESSED}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_LONG\_PRESSED\_REPEAT}}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.

\#\#Keys

The following \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the Page:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT/LEFT/UP/DOWN} Scroll the page

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.

\subsubsection{Preloader (lv\_preload)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/preload:preloader-lv-preload}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/preload::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/preload:overview}}
The preloader object is a spinning arc over a border.


\subparagraph{Arc length}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/preload:arc-length}}
The length of the arc can be adjusted by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_preload\_set\_arc\_length(preload, deg)}}.


\subparagraph{Spinning speed}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/preload:spinning-speed}}
The speed of the spinning can be adjusted by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_preload\_set\_spin\_time(preload, time\_ms)}}.


\subparagraph{Spin types}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/preload:spin-types}}
You can choose from more spin types:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PRELOAD\_TYPE\_SPINNING\_ARC} spin the arc, slow down on the top

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PRELOAD\_TYPE\_FILLSPIN\_ARC} spin the arc, slow down on the top but also stretch the arc

\end{itemize}

To apply one if them use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_preload\_set\_type(preload, LV\_PRELOAD\_TYPE\_...)}}


\subparagraph{Spin direction}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/preload:spin-direction}}
The direction of spinning can be changed with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_preload\_set\_dir(preload, LV\_PRELOAD\_DIR\_FORWARD/BACKWARD)}}.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/preload:styles}}
You can set the styles with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_preload\_set\_style(btn, LV\_PRELOAD\_STYLE\_MAIN, \&style)}}. It describes both the arc and the border style:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{arc} is described by the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{line}} properties

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{border} is described by the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{body.border}} properties including \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{body.padding.left/top}} (the smaller is used) to give a smaller radius for the border.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/preload:events}}
Only the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} are sent by the object type.


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/preload:keys}}
No \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the object type.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.

\subsubsection{Roller (lv\_roller)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/roller:roller-lv-roller}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/roller::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/roller:overview}}
Roller allows you to simply select one option from more with scrolling. Its functionalities are similar to {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/ddlist::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Drop down list}}}}.


\subparagraph{Set options}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/roller:set-options}}
The options are passed to the Roller as a string with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_set\_options(roller, options, LV\_ROLLER\_MODE\_NORMAL/INFINITE)}}. The options should be separated by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textbackslash{}n}}. For example: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"First\textbackslash{}nSecond\textbackslash{}nThird"}}.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_ROLLER\_MODE\_INIFINITE}} make the roller circular.

You can select an option manually with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_set\_selected(roller, id)}}, where \sphinxstyleemphasis{id} is the index of an option.


\subparagraph{Get selected option}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/roller:get-selected-option}}
The get the currently selected option use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_get\_selected(roller)}} it will return the \sphinxstyleemphasis{index} of the selected option.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_get\_selected\_str(roller, buf, buf\_size)}} copy the name of the selected option to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{buf}}.


\subparagraph{Align the options}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/roller:align-the-options}}
To align the label horizontally use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_set\_align(roller, LV\_LABEL\_ALIGN\_LEFT/CENTER/RIGHT)}}.


\subparagraph{Height and width}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/roller:height-and-width}}
You can set the number of visible rows with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_set\_visible\_row\_count(roller, num)}}

The width is adjusted automatically according to the width of the options. To prevent this apply \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_set\_fix\_width(roller, width)}}. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} means to use auto width.


\subparagraph{Animation time}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/roller:animation-time}}
When the Roller is scrolled and doesn’t stop exactly on an option it will scroll to the nearest valid option automatically.
The time of this scroll animation can be changed by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_set\_anim\_time(roller, anim\_time)}}. Zero animation time means no animation.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/roller:styles}}
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_set\_style(roller, LV\_ROLLER\_STYLE\_..., \&style)}} set the styles of a Roller.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_ROLLER\_STYLE\_BG} Style of the background. All \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties are used. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.text}} is used for the option’s label. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_ROLLER\_STYLE\_SEL} Style of the selected option.  The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties are used. The selected option will be recolored with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{text.color}}. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_plain\_color}}

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/roller:events}}
Besides, the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Drop down lists:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} sent when a new option is selected

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/roller:keys}}
The following \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the Buttons:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT/DOWN} Select the next option

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT/UP} Select the previous option

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LY\_KEY\_ENTER} Apply the selected option (Send \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED}} event)

\end{itemize}

\subsubsection{Slider (lv\_slider)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/slider:slider-lv-slider}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/slider::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/slider:overview}}
The Slider object looks like a {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/bar::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Bar}}}} supplemented with a knob. The knob can be dragged to set a value. The Slider also can be vertical or horizontal.


\paragraph{Value and range}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/slider:value-and-range}}
To set an initial value use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_slider\_set\_value(slider, new\_value, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}}.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_slider\_set\_anim\_time(slider, anim\_time)}} sets the animation time in milliseconds.

To specify the \sphinxstylestrong{range} (min, max values) the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_slider\_set\_range(slider, min , max)}} can be used.


\subparagraph{Knob placement}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/slider:knob-placement}}
The knob can be placed in two ways:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
inside the background

\item {} 
on the edges on min/max values

\end{itemize}

Use the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_slider\_set\_knob\_in(slider, true/false)}} to choose between the modes. (\sphinxstyleemphasis{knob\_in = false} is the default)


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/slider:styles}}
You can modify the slider’s styles with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_slider\_set\_style(slider, LV\_SLIDER\_STYLE\_..., \&style)}}.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SLIDER\_STYLE\_BG} Style of the background. All \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties are used. The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding}} values make the knob larger than the background. (negative value makes is larger)

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SLIDER\_STYLE\_INDIC} Style of the indicator. All \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties are used. The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding}} values make the indicator smaller than the background.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SLIDER\_STYLE\_KNOB} Style of the knob.  All \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties are used except \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding}}.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/slider:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Slider:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} Sent while the slider is being dragged or changed with keys.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/slider:keys}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_UP}, \sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT} Increment the slider’s value by 1

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_DOWN}, \sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT} Decrement the slider’s value by 1

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.

\subsubsection{Spinbox (lv\_spinbox)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/spinbox:spinbox-lv-spinbox}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/spinbox::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/spinbox:overview}}
The Spinbox contains a number as text which can be increased or decreased by \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} or API functions.
The Spinbox is a modified {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/ta::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Text area}}}}.


\subparagraph{Set format}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/spinbox:set-format}}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_set\_digit\_format(spinbox, digit\_count, separator\_position)}} set the format of the number.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{digit\_count}} sets the number of digits. Leading zeros are added to fill the space on the left.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{separator\_position}} sets the number of digit before the decimal point. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} means no decimal point.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_set\_padding\_left(spinbox, cnt)}} add \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cnt}} “space” characters between the sign an the most left digit.


\subparagraph{Value and ranges}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/spinbox:value-and-ranges}}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_set\_range(spinbox, min, max)}} sets the range of the Spinbox.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_set\_value(spinbox, num)}} sets the Spinbox’s value manually.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_increment(spinbox)}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_decrement(spinbox)}} increments/decrements the value of the Spinbox.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_set\_step(spinbox, step)}} sets the amount to increment decrement.


\paragraph{Style usage}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/spinbox:style-usage}}
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_set\_style(roller, LV\_SPINBOX\_STYLE\_..., \&style)}} set the styles of a Spinbox.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SPINBOX\_STYLE\_BG} Style of the background. All \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties are used. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.text}} is used for label. Default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty}}

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SPINBOX\_STYLE\_SB} Scrollbar’s style which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.right/bottom}} sets horizontal and vertical the scrollbars’ padding respectively and the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.inner}} sets the scrollbar’s width. (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty\_color}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SPINBOX\_STYLE\_CURSOR} Style of the cursor which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties including \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding}} to make the cursor larger then the digits.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/spinbox:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Drop down lists:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} sent when the value has changed. (the value is set as event data as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int32\_t}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_INSERT} sent by the ancestor Text area but shouldn’t be used.

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/spinbox:keys}}
The following \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the Buttons:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT/RIGHT} With \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keypad} move the cursor left/right. With \sphinxstyleemphasis{Encoder} decrement/increment the selected digit.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LY\_KEY\_ENTER} Apply the selected option (Send \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED}} event and close the Drop down list)

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_ENTER} With \sphinxstyleemphasis{Encoder} got the net digit. Jump to the first after the last.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Example}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/spinbox:example}}

\subsubsection{Switch (lv\_sw)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/sw:switch-lv-sw}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/sw::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/sw:overview}}
The Switch can be used to turn on/off something. The look like a little slider.


\subparagraph{Change state}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/sw:change-state}}
The state of the switch can be changed by
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Clicking on it

\item {} 
Sliding it

\item {} 
Using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_sw\_on(sw, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_sw\_off(sw, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_sw\_toggle(sw, LV\_ANOM\_ON/OFF)}} functions

\end{itemize}


\subparagraph{Animation time}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/sw:animation-time}}
The time of animations, when the switch changes state, can be adjusted with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_sw\_set\_anim\_time(sw, anim\_time)}}.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/sw:styles}}
You can modify the Switch’s styles with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_sw\_set\_style(sw, LV\_SW\_STYLE\_..., \&style)}}.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SW\_STYLE\_BG} Style of the background. All \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties are used. The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding}} values make the Switch smaller than the knob. (negative value makes is larger)

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SW\_STYLE\_INDIC} Style of the indicator. All \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties are used. The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding}} values make the indicator smaller than the background.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SW\_STYLE\_KNOB\_OFF} Style of the knob when the switch is off.  The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties are used except padding.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SW\_STYLE\_KNOB\_ON} Style of the knob when the switch is on.  The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties are used except padding.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/sw:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Switch:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} Sent when the switch changes state.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/sw:keys}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_UP}, \sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT} Turn on the slider

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_DOWN}, \sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT} Turn off the slider

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.

\subsubsection{Table (lv\_table)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:table-lv-table}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/table::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:overview}}
Tables, as usual, are built from rows, columns, and cells containing texts.

The Table object is very light weighted because only the texts are stored. No real objects are created for cells but they are just drawn on the fly.


\subparagraph{Rows and Columns}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:rows-and-columns}}
To set number of rows and columns use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_row\_cnt(table, row\_cnt)}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_col\_cnt(table, col\_cnt)}}


\subparagraph{Width and Height}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:width-and-height}}
The width of the columns can be set with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_col\_width(table, col\_id, width)}}. The overall width of the Table object will be set to the sum of columns widths.

The height is calculated automatically from the cell styles (font, padding etc) and the number of rows.


\subparagraph{Set cell value}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:set-cell-value}}
The cells can store on texts so need to convert numbers to text before displaying them in a table.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_cell\_value(table, row, col, "Content")}}. The text is saved by the table so it can be even a local variable.

Line break can be used in the text like \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"Value\textbackslash{}n60.3"}}.


\subparagraph{Align}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:align}}
The text alignment in cells can be adjusted individually with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_cell\_align(table, row, col, LV\_LABEL\_ALIGN\_LEFT/CENTER/RIGHT)}}.


\subparagraph{Cell type}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:cell-type}}
You can use 4 different cell types. Each has its own style.

Cell types can be used to add different style for example to:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
table header

\item {} 
first column

\item {} 
highlight a cell

\item {} 
etc

\end{itemize}

The type can be selected with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_cell\_type(table, row, col, type)}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{type}} can be 1, 2, 3 or 4.


\subparagraph{Merge cells}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:merge-cells}}
Cells can be merged horizontally with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_cell\_merge\_right(table, col, row, true)}}. To merge more adjacent cells apply this function for each cell.


\subparagraph{Crop text}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:crop-text}}
By default, the texts are word-wrapped to fit into the width of the cell and the height of the cell is set automatically. To disable this and keep the text as it is enable \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_cell\_crop(table, row, col, true)}}.


\subparagraph{Scroll}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:scroll}}
The make the Table scrollable place it on a {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}}


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:styles}}
Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_style(page, LV\_TABLE\_STYLE\_...,  \&style)}} to set a new style for an element of the page:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PAGE\_STYLE\_BG} background’s style which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_plain\_color}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_PAGE\_STYLE\_CELL1/2/3/4} 4 for styles for the 4 cell types. All \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties are used. (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_plain}})

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:events}}
Only the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} are sent by the object type.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:keys}}
No \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the object type.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.


\paragraph{Example}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/table:example}}

\subsubsection{Tabview (lv\_tabview)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tabview:tabview-lv-tabview}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/tabview::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tabview:overview}}
The Tab view object can be used to organize content in tabs.


\subparagraph{Adding tab}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tabview:adding-tab}}
You can add a new tabs with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tabview\_add\_tab(tabview, "Tab name")}}. It will return with a pointer to a {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} object where you can add the tab’s content.


\subparagraph{Change tab}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tabview:change-tab}}
To select a new tab you can:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Click on it on the header part

\item {} 
Slide horizontally

\item {} 
Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tabview\_set\_tab\_act(tabview, id, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}} function

\end{itemize}

The manual sliding can be disabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tabview\_set\_sliding(tabview, false)}}.


\subparagraph{Tab button’s position}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tabview:tab-button-s-position}}
By default, the tab selector buttons are placed on the top of the Tabview. It can be changed with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tabview\_set\_btns\_pos(tabview, LV\_TABVIEW\_BTNS\_POS\_TOP/BOTTOM/LEFT/RIGHT)}}

Note that, you can’t change the tab position from top or bottom to left or right when tabs are already added.


\subparagraph{Hide the tabs}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tabview:hide-the-tabs}}
The tab buttons can be hidden by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tabview\_set\_btns\_hidden(tabview, true)}}


\subparagraph{Animation time}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tabview:animation-time}}
The animation time is adjusted by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tabview\_set\_anim\_time(tabview, anim\_time\_ms)}}. It is used when the new tab is loaded.


\paragraph{Style usage}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tabview:style-usage}}
Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tabview\_set\_style(tabview, LV\_TABVIEW\_STYLE\_...,  \&style)}} to set a new style for an element of the Tabview:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_TABVIEW\_STYLE\_BG} main background which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_plain}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_TABVIEW\_STYLE\_INDIC} a thin rectangle on indicating the current tab. Uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties. Its height comes from \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{body.padding.inner}} (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_plain\_color}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_TABVIEW\_STYLE\_BTN\_BG} style of the tab buttons’ background. Uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties. The header height will be set automatically considering \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{body.padding.top/bottom}} (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_transp}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_TABVIEW\_STYLE\_BTN\_REL} style of released tab buttons. Uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties.  (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_tbn\_rel}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_TABVIEW\_STYLE\_BTN\_PR} style of released tab buttons. Uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties except \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding}}.  (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_tbn\_rel}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_TABVIEW\_STYLE\_BTN\_TGL\_REL} style of selected released tab buttons. Uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties except \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding}}.  (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_tbn\_rel}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_TABVIEW\_STYLE\_BTN\_TGL\_PR} style of selected pressed tab buttons. Uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties except \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding}}.  (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_tgl\_pr}})

\end{itemize}

The height of the header is calculated like:
\sphinxstyleemphasis{font height and padding.top and padding.bottom from LV\_TABVIEW\_STYLE\_BTN\_REL + padding.top and padding bottom from LV\_TABVIEW\_STYLE\_BTN\_BG}


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tabview:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Slider:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} Sent when a new tab is selected by sliding or clicking the tab button

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tabview:keys}}
The following \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the Tabview:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT/LEFT} Select a tab

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_ENTER} Change to the selected tab

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.

\subsubsection{Text area (lv\_ta)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:text-area-lv-ta}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:overview}}
The Text Area is a {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} with a {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/label::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Label}}}} and a cursor on it. Texts or characters can be added to it. Long lines are wrapped and when the text becomes long enough the Text area can be scrolled-


\subparagraph{Add text}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:add-text}}
You can insert text or characters  to the current cursor’s position with:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_add\_char(ta, 'c')}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_add\_text(ta, "insert this text")}}

\end{itemize}

To add wide characters like \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{'á'}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{'ß'}} or CJK characters use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_add\_text(ta, "á")}}.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_text(ta, "New text")}} changes the whole text.


\subparagraph{Placeholder}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:placeholder}}
A placeholder text can be specified which is displayed when the Text area is empty with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_placeholder\_text(ta, "Placeholder text")}}


\subparagraph{Delete character}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:delete-character}}
To delete a character from the left of the current cursor position use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_del\_char(ta)}}. The delete from teh right use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_del\_char\_forward(ta)}}


\subparagraph{Move the cursor}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:move-the-cursor}}
The cursor position can be modified directly with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_cursor\_pos(ta, 10)}}. The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} position means “before the first characters”, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TA\_CURSOR\_LAST}} means “after the last character”

You can step the cursor with
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_cursor\_right(ta)}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_cursor\_left(ta)}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_cursor\_up(ta)}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_cursor\_down(ta)}}

\end{itemize}

If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_cursor\_click\_pos(ta, true)}} is called the cursor will jump to the position where the Text area was clicked.


\subparagraph{Cursor types}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:cursor-types}}
There are several cursor types. You can set one of them with: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_cursor\_type(ta, LV\_CURSOR\_...)}}
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CURSOR\_NONE} No cursor

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CURSOR\_LINE} A simple vertical line

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CURSOR\_BLOCK} A filled rectangle on the current character

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CURSOR\_OUTLINE} A rectangle border around the current character

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_CURSOR\_UNDERLINE} Underline the current character

\end{itemize}

You can ‘OR’ \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_CURSOR\_HIDDEN}} to any type to temporarily hide the cursor.

The blink time of the cursor can be adjusted with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_cursor\_blink\_time(ta, time\_ms)}}.


\subparagraph{One line mode}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:one-line-mode}}
The Text area can be configures to be one lined with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_one\_line(ta, true)}}. In this mode the height is set automatically to show only one line, line break character are ignored, and word wrap is disabled.


\subparagraph{Password mode}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:password-mode}}
The text area supports password mode which can be enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_pwd\_mode(ta, true)}}. In password mode, the enters characters are converted to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{*}} after some time or when a new character is entered.

In password mode \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_get\_text(ta)}} gives the real text and not the asterisk characters

The visibility time can be adjusted with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_pwd\_show\_time(ta, time\_ms)}}.


\subparagraph{Text align}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:text-align}}
The text can be aligned to the left, center or right with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_text\_align(ta, LV\_LABEL\_ALIGN\_LET/CENTER/RIGHT)}}.

In one line mode, the text can be scrolled horizontally only if the text is left aligned.


\subparagraph{Accepted characters}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:accepted-characters}}
You can set a list of accepted characters with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_accepted\_chars(ta, "0123456789.+-")}}. Other characters will be ignored.


\subparagraph{Max text length}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:max-text-length}}
The maximum number of characters can be limited with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_max\_length(ta, max\_char\_num)}}


\subparagraph{Very long texts}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:very-long-texts}}
If there is a  very long text in the Text area  (\textgreater{} 20k characters) its scrolling and drawing might be slow.
However, by enabling \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_LABEL\_LONG\_TXT\_HINT   1}} in \sphinxstyleemphasis{lv\_conf.h} it can be hugely improved.
It will save some info about the label to speed up its drawing. Using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_LABEL\_LONG\_TXT\_HINT}} the scrolling and drawing will as fast as with “normal” short texts.


\subparagraph{Select text}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:select-text}}
A part of text can be selected if enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_text\_sel(ta, true)}}. It works like when you select a text on your PC with your mouse.


\subparagraph{Scrollbars}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:scrollbars}}
The scrollbars can shown according to different policies set by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_sb\_mode(ta, LV\_SB\_MODE\_...)}}. Learn more at the {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} object.


\subparagraph{Scroll propagation}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:scroll-propagation}}
When the Text area is scrolled on an other scrollable object (like a Page) and the scrolling has reached the edge of the Text area, the scrolling can be propagated to the parent.
In other words, when the Text area can be scrolled further, the parent will be scrolled instead.

It can be enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_scroll\_propagation(ta, true)}}.

Learn more at the {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} object.


\subparagraph{Edge flash}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:edge-flash}}
When the Text area is scrolled to edge a circle like flash animation can be shown if it is enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_edge\_flash(ta, true)}}


\paragraph{Style usage}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:style-usage}}
Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_style(page, LV\_TA\_STYLE\_...,  \&style)}} to set a new style for an element of the text area:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_TA\_STYLE\_BG} background’s style which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties. The label uses \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.label}} from this style.  (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_TA\_STYLE\_SB} scrollbar’s style which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty\_color}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_TA\_STYLE\_CURSOR} cursor style. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{NULL}} then the library sets a style automatically according to the label’s color and font
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstyleemphasis{LV\_CURSOR\_LINE}: a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.line.width}} wide line but drawn as a rectangle as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}}. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.top/left}} makes an offset on the cursor

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleemphasis{LV\_CURSOR\_BLOCK}: a rectangle as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}}  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding}} makes the rectangle larger

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleemphasis{LV\_CURSOR\_OUTLINE}: an empty rectangle (just a border) as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding}} makes the rectangle larger

\item {} 
\sphinxstyleemphasis{LV\_CURSOR\_UNDERLINE}: a \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.line.width}} wide line but drawn as a rectangle as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}}. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{padding.top/left}} makes an offset on the cursor

\end{itemize}

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Slider:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_INSERT} Sent when a character before a character is inserted.
The evnet data is the text planned to insert. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_insert\_replace(ta, "New text")}} replaces the text to insert.
The new text can’t be in a local variable which is destroyed when the event callback exists. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{""}} means do not insert anything.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} When the content of the text area has been changed.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/ta:keys}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT} Move the cursor

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{Any character} Add the character to the current cursor position

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.

\subsubsection{Tile view (lv\_tileview)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tileview:tile-view-lv-tileview}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/tileview::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tileview:overview}}
The Tileview a container object where its elements (called \sphinxstyleemphasis{tiles}) can be arranged in a grid form. By swiping the user can navigate between the tiles.

If the Tileview is screen sized it gives a user interface you might have seen on the smartwatches.


\subparagraph{Valid positions}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tileview:valid-positions}}
The tiles don’t have to form a full grid where every element exists. There can be holes in the grid but it has to be continuous, i.e. there can the be an empty row or column.

With \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_set\_valid\_positions(tileview, valid\_pos\_array, array\_len)}}the valid positions can be set. Scrolling will be possible only to this positions. the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0,0}} index means the top left tile.
E.g. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_point\_t valid\_pos\_array{[}{]} = \{\{0,0\}, \{0,1\}, \{1,1\}, \{\{LV\_COORD\_MIN, LV\_COORD\_MIN\}\}}} gives a Tile view with “L” shape. It indicates that there is no tile in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{1,1\}}} therefore the user can’t scroll there.

In other words, the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{valid\_pos\_array}} tells where the tiles are. It can be changed on the fly to disable some positions on specific tiles.
For example, there can be a 2x2 grid where all tiles are added but the first row (y = 0) as a  “main row” and the second row (y = 1) contains options for the tile above it.
Let’s say horizontal scrolling is possible only in the main row and not possible between the options in the second row. In this case the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{valid\_pos\_array}} needs to changed when a new main tile is selected:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
for the first main tile: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{0,0\}, \{0,1\}, \{1,0\}}} to disable the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{1,1\}}} option tile

\item {} 
for the second main tile \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{0,0\}, \{1,0\}, \{1,1\}}} to disable the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{0,1\}}} option tile

\end{itemize}


\subparagraph{Add element}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tileview:add-element}}
To add elements just create an object on the Tileview and call \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_add\_element(tielview, element)}}.

The element should have the same size than the Tile view and needs to be positioned manually to the desired position.

The scroll propagation feature of page-like objects (like {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/list::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{List}}}}) can be used very well here.
For example, there can be a full-sized List and when it reaches the top or bottom most position the user will scroll the tile view instead.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_add\_element(tielview, element)}} should be used to make possible to scroll (drag) the Tileview by one its element.For example, if there is a button on a tile, the button needs to be explicitly added to the Tileview to enable the user to scroll the Tileview with the button too.

It true for the buttons on a {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/list::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{List}}}} as well. Every list button and the list itself needs to be added with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_add\_element}}.


\subparagraph{Set tile}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tileview:set-tile}}
To set the currently visible tile use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_set\_tile\_act(tileview, x\_id, y\_id, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}}.


\subparagraph{Animation time}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tileview:animation-time}}
The animation time when a tile
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
is selected with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_set\_tile\_act}}

\item {} 
is scrolled a little and then released (revert the original title)

\item {} 
is scrolled more than half size and  then release (move to the next tile)

\end{itemize}

can be set with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_set\_anim\_time(tileview, anim\_time)}}.


\subparagraph{Edge flash}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tileview:edge-flash}}
An “edge flash” effect can be added when the tile view reached hits an invalid position or the end of tile view when scrolled.

Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_set\_edge\_flash(tileview, true)}} to enable this feature.


\paragraph{Styles}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tileview:styles}}
The Tileview has on one style which van be changes with  \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_set\_style(slider, LV\_TILEVIEW\_STYLE\_MAIN, \&style)}}.
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_TILEVIEW\_STYLE\_MAIN} Style of the background. All \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties are used.

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tileview:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Slider:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} Sent when a new tile loaded either with scrolling or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_set\_act}}. The event data is set ti the index of the new tile in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{valid\_pos\_array}} (It’s type is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{uint32\_t *}})

\end{itemize}


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/tileview:keys}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_UP}, \sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT} Increment the slider’s value by 1

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_DOWN}, \sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT} Decrement the slider’s value by 1

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.

\subsubsection{Window (lv\_win)}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/win:window-lv-win}}\label{\detokenize{object-types/win::doc}}

\paragraph{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/win:overview}}
The windows are one of the most complex container-like objects. They are built from two main parts:
\begin{enumerate}
\def\theenumi{\arabic{enumi}}
\def\labelenumi{\theenumi .}
\makeatletter\def\p@enumii{\p@enumi \theenumi .}\makeatother
\item {} 
a header {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/cont::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Container}}}} on the top

\item {} 
a {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} for the content below the header.

\end{enumerate}


\subparagraph{Title}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/win:title}}
On the header, there is a title which can be modified by: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_set\_title(win, "New title")}}. The title always inherits the style of the header.


\subparagraph{Control buttons}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/win:control-buttons}}
You can add control buttons to the right side of the header with: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_add\_btn(win, LV\_SYMBOL\_CLOSE)}}.
The second parameter is an {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/img::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Image}}}} source.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_close\_event\_cb}} can be used as an event callback to close the Window.

You can modify the size of the control buttons with the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_set\_btn\_size(win, new\_size)}} function.


\subparagraph{Scrollbars}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/win:scrollbars}}
The scrollbar behavior can be set by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_set\_sb\_mode(win, LV\_SB\_MODE\_...)}}. See {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} for details.


\subparagraph{Manual scroll and focus}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/win:manual-scroll-and-focus}}
To scroll the Window directly you can use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_scroll\_hor(win, dist\_px)}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_scroll\_ver(win, dist\_px)}}.

To make the Window show an object on it use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_focus(win, child, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}}.

The time of scroll and focus animations can  be adjusted with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_set\_anim\_time(win, anim\_time\_ms)}}


\subparagraph{Layout}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/win:layout}}
To set a layout for the content use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_set\_layout(win, LV\_LAYOUT\_...)}}. See {\hyperref[\detokenize{object-types/cont::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Container}}}} for details.


\paragraph{Style usage}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/win:style-usage}}
Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_set\_style(win, LV\_WIN\_STYLE\_...,  \&style)}} to set a new style for an element of the Window:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_WIN\_STYE\_BG} main background which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties (header and content page are placed on it) (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_plain}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_WIN\_STYLE\_CONTENT} content page’s scrollable part which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_transp}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_WIN\_STYLE\_SB} scroll bar’s style which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{left/top}} padding sets the scrollbars’ padding respectively and the inner padding sets the scrollbar’s width.  (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_pretty\_color}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_WIN\_STYLE\_HEADER} header’s style which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_plain\_color}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_WIN\_STYLE\_BTN\_REL} released button’s style (on header) which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_rel}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_WIN\_STYLE\_BTN\_PR} released button’s style (on header) which uses all \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{style.body}} properties (default: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_style\_btn\_pr}})

\end{itemize}

The height of the header is set to the greater value from \sphinxstyleemphasis{buttons’ height} (set by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_set\_btn\_size}}) and \sphinxstyleemphasis{title height} (comes from \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{header\_style.text.font}}) plus the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{body.padding.top}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{body.padding.bottom}} of the header style.


\paragraph{Events}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/win:events}}
Only the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} are sent by the object type.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.


\paragraph{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/win:keys}}
The following \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the Page:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT/LEFT/UP/DOWN} Scroll the page

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.


\paragraph{Example}
\label{\detokenize{object-types/win:example}}
